title: Mark RowStream as `must_use`

title: Breaking! Move a lot of `get::<T>` functions to use `serde` instead of `TryFrom<BoltType>`
body:
* Most usages should keep working as is
* Getting the timezone offset requires using `neo4rs::Offset` instead of `chrono::FixedOffset` as the latter one does not implement `serde::Deserialize`
* A lot of other things are now possible

title: Add `_on` variants to tx/run/execute that allow selecting the db per call

title: Use the MSRV lockfile for MSRV tests
Allow HashMap to/from BoltType conversion
Share test code between integration tests and doc examples
Breaking! Change `labels` and `type` to return `&str` instead of `String`

title: Add keys method to nodes/rels
body:
Based on #100
Replaces #84

title: Extract more additional data via serde
Implement From<Option> for BoltType
body:
Query strings that use a placeholder `$foo` for an `Option<Into<BoltType>>` cannot be constructed without first knowing if the option is `None`. This is bothersome because basic query strings for a struct can be determined without `self`, but filling in query params requires a `self`.

This PR associates a query parameter  of  `None` to mean `BoltType::Null(BoltNull)`. 

Does this change semantics? Before this, removing a property on an entity could be done via `SET n.prop = null`, but now it could be done with `SET n.prop = $prop`. It allows a kind of silly Option<Vec<Option<A>>> as a type. 

Will `serde` support take care of this (there's a draft PR)?

title: add Query::has_param_key
body: This is to expose the ability to warn, etc. if overwriting an existing param key.

title: Warn when connecting against neo4j schema
Support encrypted connections
body:
Only "proper" certificates are supported right now (i.e. `bolt+s` or `neo4j+s` schemes).
We use [`rustls`](https://lib.rs/crates/rustls) for the TLS implementation and load root certificates with [`webpki-roots`](https://lib.rs/crates/webpki-roots).
Self-signed certificates are not supported yet.

We plan to support self-signed certificates, as well as custom certificate chains und native TLS implementations in the future.

Only manually tested against Aura, no automated tests yet until we figure out how to create a testcontainer with an encrypted server setup.


Fixes #81

title: Update CI configuration
body:
- Use nextest to run tests
- Explicitly run fmt and clippy
- Use rust cache

title: Support Neo4j 5.x alongside Neo4j 4.4
body: Closes #24

title: Pass multiple params as a hashmap
body:
Here we can pass params as a standard hashmap.

Reason being it is tedious to keep calling param constantly for each new input. 

This will make it more pleasing to work with as a lot of people already have hashmaps in their projects.

title: bool type in params
body: Issue https://github.com/neo4j-labs/neo4rs/issues/66

title: Implement Error trait using thiserror.
body:
This implements the error trait using `thiserror`.

In general, restructuring the Error type would probably a good idea (e.g. have type and marker as fields of `InvalidMarker` instead of a message string), but that would be a breaking change.

title: Compatibility with Neo4j version 5 and 4.4.
body:
According to the [specification](https://neo4j.com/docs/bolt/current/packstream/) a struct with 3 fields is supposed to have the marker `B3`.

The `Run` struct was marked with `B1` instead (struct with 1 field), which causes problems with Neo4j 5.2.

After changing it to `B3` all test run successfully with versions 4.4.18 and 5.2.0.

Additionally `distance` was renamed to `point.distance` in version 4.4 ([reference](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/4.4/functions/spatial/)).

title: Update dependencies.
body: This updates `deadpool` and `uuid` to the newest version. Some changes were necessary due to API changes in `deadpool`.

title: Setup Github Actions CI
body:
- Add a justfile
- Add all examples as integration tests
- Switch CI to github actions

title: Eliminate warnings and deprecations from docs
body:
- Fully qualify links in docs
- Don't use deprecated methods in doc tests

title: Add more From impls for numbers
body:
- Implement From for most number types for BoltType
- Implement From byte slice for BoltType
- Update doc test for raw bytes to use a byte slice

title: Fix clippy warnings
body:
- Fix deprecation warnings
- Fix typo in ConversionError
- Replace Into impls with From impls
- Derive Default for BoltMap
- Remove same postfix
- Remove useless try operator

title: Fix deprecation warnings
body:
- Fix deprecation warnings
- Fix typo in ConversionError

title: Implement Into/TryFrom BoltType for Vec and Into for f64
body:
In its current state, neo4rs does not appear to support lists/vectors in node properties and probably elsewhere due to missing `Into` and `TryFrom` implementations. This patch firstly adds support for `Vec<A>` given `A` is already convertible to/from `BoltType`. Secondly, an implementation of `Into<BoltType> for f64` is provided, as this seems to be already supported the other way around.

These changes together should allow using neo4rs to work with databases containing vector embeddings. Edits by maintainers are on, so feel free to edit anything if it's not up to standard.
